questions.question: The Province of Alberta has a law that is known as the Absolute Liability Law. In an automobile accident, the third party suffers injuries. The insured has made a material change in the operation of the vehicle. One of the following statements is true:

An insurer must pay a minimum of $500,000 to all injured parties
